data.value: This function computes the N-D discrete Fourier Transform over any number of axes in an M-D array by means of the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT).

, contains the term for zero frequency in the low-order corner of all axes, the positive frequency terms in the first half of all axes, the term for the Nyquist frequency in the middle of all axes and the negative frequency terms in the second half of all axes, in order of decreasingly negative frequency.
Shape (length of each transformed axis) of the output (
to axis 1, etc.). This corresponds to
. Along any axis, if the given shape is smaller than that of the input, the input is cropped. If it is larger, the input is padded with zeros. if
is not given, the shape of the input along the axes specified by
Axes over which to compute the FFT. If not given, the last
axes are used, or all axes if
can be destroyed; the default is False. See
Maximum number of workers to use for parallel computation. If negative, the value wraps around from
This argument is reserved for passing in a precomputed plan provided by downstream FFT vendors. It is currently not used in SciPy.
is larger than than the number of axes of
The truncated or zero-padded input, transformed along the axes indicated by
, as explained in the parameters section above.
Compute the N-D discrete Fourier Transform.
The 1-D FFT, with definitions and conventions used.
The N-D FFT of real input.
Shifts zero-frequency terms to centre of array.
